content.en: Pulmonary Mechanics Algorithms: Researchers have been investigating the influence of various factors on the assessment of pulmonary mechanics in mechanical ventilation, such as imprecise breath detection, phase shift, and noise. They have found that algorithms, specifically the least squares fit (LSF) method, can accurately assess pulmonary mechanics even in the presence of high levels of noise. Additionally, algorithms have been developed to estimate compliance in intensive care patients in real-time, monitor respiratory mechanics during ongoing ventilator treatment, and accurately monitor lung mechanics measurements during different ventilation methods. These advancements in algorithmic technology offer simple and reliable methods for monitoring and optimizing mechanical ventilation in patients.
content.da: Pulmonale mekaniske algoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt indflydelsen af forskellige faktorer på vurderingen af pulmonale mekanik ved mekanisk ventilation, såsom upræcis vejrtrækningsdetektion, faseskift og støj. De har fundet, at algoritmer, specifikt metoden mindste kvadraters fit (LSF), kan nøjagtigt vurdere pulmonale mekanik selv i nærvær af høje støjniveauer. Derudover er der blevet udviklet algoritmer til at estimere compliance hos intensivpatienter i realtid, overvåge respiratoriske mekanismer under igangværende ventilationsbehandlinger, og nøjagtigt overvåge lungeopmålingsmålinger under forskellige ventilationsmetoder. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmeteknologi tilbyder enkle og pålidelige metoder til at overvåge og optimere mekanisk ventilation hos patienter.
